measure.name: residential_dishwasher
measure.description: Adds (or replaces) a residential dishwasher with the specified efficiency, operation, and schedule. For multifamily buildings, the dishwasher can be set for all units of the building. See https://github.com/NREL/OpenStudio-BuildStock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: Since there is no Dishwasher object in OpenStudio/EnergyPlus, we look for an ElectricEquipment object with the name that denotes it is a residential dishwasher. If one is found, it is replaced with the specified properties. Otherwise, a new such object is added to the model. Note: This measure requires the number of bedrooms/bathrooms to have already been assigned.

argument.name: num_settings
argument.description: The number of place settings for the unit. Data obtained from manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: rated_annual_energy
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the dishwasher, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating.

argument.name: has_internal_heater
argument.description: Does the system use an internal electric heater to adjust water temperature? Input obtained from manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: cold_inlet
argument.description: Does the dishwasher use a cold water connection only. Input obtained from manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: cold_use
argument.display_name: Cold Water Conn Use Per Cycle
argument.description: Volume of water per cycle used if there is only a cold water inlet connection, for the dishwasher. Input obtained from manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: annual_gas_cost
argument.description: Annual cost of gas, as rated. Obtained from the EnergyGuide label.

argument.name: mult_e
argument.description: Appliance energy use is multiplied by this factor to account for occupancy usage that differs from the national average.

argument.name: mult_hw
argument.description: Appliance hot water use is multiplied by this factor to account for occupancy usage that differs from the national average. This should generally be equal to the Occupancy Energy Multiplier.

argument.name: location
argument.description: The space type for the location. 'auto' will automatically choose a space type based on the space types found in the model.

argument.name: plant_loop
argument.description: Select the plant loop for the dishwasher. 'auto' will try to choose the plant loop associated with the specified space. For multifamily buildings, 'auto' will choose the plant loop for each unit of the building.

argument.name: schedule_day_shift
argument.description: Draw profiles are shifted to prevent coincident hot water events when performing portfolio analyses. For multifamily buildings, draw profiles for each unit are automatically shifted by one week.
